channel.title: LLscape.net new server
channel.description:
Just released the server. More like a pseudo release though, still fixing all the stuff that's not 100% functional (only minor things left). Website is designed from scratch, I'm tired of these crappy sites... And basically it's a release of SwagPk, but with improvements and changes.
Features/changes:
[ul][li]99 is max stat (SwagPK was 130)[/li] [li]No more polis/abs aka overpowered items from SwagPk[/li] [li]Did some xml editing on npcs/items to make them more insightful. (amazing right? lol)[/li] [li]Added a cache downloader/updater to client.[/li] [li]Redid a lot of server side stuff to make it run faster/more efficiently[/li] [li]Set up some server sided stuff to help me make new mini-games and such quicker/painless[/li] [li]Referral system ready to be implemented[/li] [li]Pk points[/li] [li]K/D ratios and highscores ready to be put up[/li] [li]Control panel with recovery question, account info, ect.[/li][/ul]
Pictures: [img]http://llscape.net/RSC/imgs/kbd_reflect.png[/img] Above is a KDB reflecting an arrow. (was testing for future mini-games) [img]http://llscape.net/RSC/imgs/pkpoints.png[/img] Above is a picture of one of the ways to see your pk points in-game. (Yes, that's 20k, I was testing it...)
5/28/09 - Minigame added to get new armor, same stats as rune, but a green color. (Not the same color as polis, but actually green) [img]http://img40.imageshack.us/img40/549/minigame.png[/img] It's basically a grinding minigame, kill each npc 25 times (4 npcs) and claim your reward. (Gaia armor)
BTW, the mage and ranger will mage/range you back if you try and mage/range them. The mage also mages you when you're in combat with it, and the ranger just attacks you regularly.
The client download is in the control panel.

item.title: LLscape.net new server
item.dc:creator: @LLscape.net LLscape.net
item.description:
@LLscape.net wrote:

I code 95% of swagpk, it’s not like it’s someone else’s work.

I coded the referral system, pk points, k/d ration, control panel, and most of all the good features on swagpk. Swagger just took credit for it because I didn’t really care, I just liked coding behind the scenes without dealing with everyone drama.

BTW, I actually did code server side things, unlike most ppl out there who just claim to do it.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 28, 2009, 05:34:25 pm[/size][hr]Added Gaia invaders minigame/quest.

Read full topic

item.title: LLscape.net new server
item.dc:creator: @i_own_you21 i own you21
item.description:
@i_own_you21 wrote:

i would support this server but its another person who starts with a server that already has the basics in it for that i dont if you added more then you did before releasing it to the public i would support it but for that reason i will not support anything like this and you are a very rude person who is very cocky about his coding[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 28, 2009, 01:54:26 pm[/size][hr]Referral system ready to be implemented
Pk points
K/D ratios and highscores ready to be put up
Control panel with recovery question, account info, ect.

all of that was ethier already in the sever swagpk so there is a fail right there

99 is max stat (SwagPK was 130)
No more polis/abs aka overpowered items from SwagPk
Did some xml editing on npcs/items to make them more insightful. (amazing right? lol)
Added a cache downloader/updater to client.
Redid a lot of server side stuff to make it run faster/more efficiently
Set up some server sided stuff to help me make new mini-games and such quicker/painless
and all of that shit is easy and bs shit of people saying they can code when they did nothing they say you coded a few server side things that ethier make the game run better or make it easyer or easyer for you to make certain things SO ALL BS

But i do respect you for having the guts to put this up <3 gl

Read full topic

item.description:
@Jessekinss wrote:

LLscape.net:

IDK, I don’t really have a lot of money atm to spend on a server, so I’m trying to find a vps or cheap dedi. I’m kind of liking http://vps.net even though they’re expensive, I like how they’re set up.

Any type of DoS tool could take down any VPS. It’s not a good idea at all to try and beat DDoS with a VPS. Lol.
